Description

A neural interface embedded in every Spacer, often installed before permanent memories form. It connects the individual to the Network, creating a shared consciousness and data stream that is fundamental to Galatean existence.

item.title: Echeryia
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Description

A lunar city that was destroyed by Terran forces during the Independence Wars. The acrid smoke from its burning traveled through maglev tunnels and lingered for years, becoming a visceral memory of the conflict for older Spacers. Echeryia had been founded before the Galatean breakaway as a Terran city-colony on the Moon and had been the epicenter of the revolt that started the breakaway.

item.title: Galatea / Galateans
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Description

The nation and people who broke away from Earth to build a society in space (city-colonies on the Moon and Mars). They are characterized by their reliance on the Network and adaptation to life in vacuum and microgravity.

Contested Term

The International Alliance of Earth (IAE) does not recognize Galatea as a sovereign nation. They call the Galateans by the derogatory term “Spacer”.

item.title: Great Famine
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Description

A historical event during which Earth cut off supply ships to the colonies, stretching rations thin and causing widespread hunger among the populations that would become the Spacers.

Contested Term

International Alliance of Earth (IAE) does not admit targeting logistic chains and pretend the Spacers were the ones that imposed a blockade first.

item.title: International Alliance of Earth (IAE). Later Designation: International Terran Alliance (ITA)
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Description

Definition: A massive, hegemonic coalition comprising Earthâ€™s major industrialized nations, primarily concentrated in the Northern Hemisphere and Australia.

Internal Dynamics: Rather than a monolithic world government, the IAE functions as a tense alliance of distinct sovereign states. While united by a common military and economic framework, member nations retain their individual cultural and political identities. This structure frequently leads to internal bureaucratic friction and power struggles among member states regarding resource allocation and military strategy.

item.title: Protected Person
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Standard Term

Description

A legal status under Earth’s laws, referencing the Geneva Conventions, which grants rights to prisoners of war. The IAE Tribunal specifically denies this status to Spacers, classifying them as hardware instead.

item.title: Sapient Bio-Construct
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Description

The legal classification the IAE attempts to apply to Spacers. This designation defines them as sophisticated organic machinery rather than human beings, stripping them of human rights and allowing for dissection and experimentation. In opposition with the status of “Protected Person.”

item.title: Spacer
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”´ Terran (Origin) â†’ ðŸ”µ Galatean (Reclaimed) | Status: Identity Term

Original Terran Usage

A derogatory term used by Terrans to dehumanize Galatean colonists. Implies that individuals are merely “equipment” designed for space operations rather than human beings with rights and autonomy.

Intent: To establish psychological distance and justify military actions against civilian populations by framing them as tools or property rather than people.

Reclaimed Galatean Identity

The rebels embraced “Spacer” as a title of pride and identity, transforming the slur into a statement of defiance. To call oneself a Spacer is to assert autonomy, humanity, and the right to exist independently from Earth.

item.title: Surinam Station
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Description

Location: Situated near the Asteroid Belt but not inside it, positioned outside the Hungaria group (a cluster of asteroids closer to Mars). Its placement creates jurisdictional ambiguity between Galatean Sector 4 (Asteroid Belt Command) and Sector 3 (Mars Defense Command).

Age: Surinam is ~70 years old in 2253, predating the current Galatean sector system, which was implemented 30 years ago. It was once an important relay and refueling station for space traffic between Mars, the Asteroid Belt, and Galatea.

item.title: Terrans
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Description

The inhabitants of Earth which are citizens of the International Alliance of Earth.

Contested Term

The inhabitants of Earth, no matter their nation or allegiance. In Galatean culture, they are often viewed as brutal and morally corrupt, while Terran propaganda views Spacers as “monsters” or “machines”.

item.title: Verse, (The) / Early designation: Network (The)
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Galatean Designation: The Verse

The collective digital and sensory connection shared by all Spacers via cortical implants. More than mere communication, it is experienced as a “chorus” of shared consciousness that prevents isolation and enables deep understanding between individuals.

Origin: The term originated from Commander Gordon Monihan’s testimony at his tribunal, where he described the connection as feeling like “the whole Universe.”

item.title: Water Test
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Description

A psychological experiment devised by Dr. Hayden. It involves tipping a water bottle to see if a Spacer instinctively saves the resource, which Hayden interprets as proof of “resource preservation programming” rather than human empathy.

Contested Term

The majority of the later Galateans think the original water test is an urban legend.

item.title: Xenopsychology
item.description:
Source: ðŸ”µ Galatean | ðŸ”´ Terran | Status: Contested Term

Description

A specialized field of science led by Dr. Hayden, dedicated to studying the minds of “non-human” entities. It is used by the IAE to pathologize Spacer behavior and justify their dehumanization.

Contested Term

Xenopsychology is not recognized as proper science in Galatea.

item.title: Behind the Scenes: The Spacer and the December Chronicles
item.description:
The Dream That Started Everything

Two years ago this December, I had a dream that changed everything.

That dream became the seed of The Galatean Saga. Since then, I’ve written, rewritten, and built out the canon of this universeâ€”its wars, its cadets, its fractured families, and its long shadow between Earth and Galatea. I’ve completed drafts for three novels, but I’ve learned something crucial: writing the books is only the beginning. The editing, polishing, cover design, formattingâ€”everything that goes into releasing something of real valueâ€”takes even longer than writing the drafts themselves.

item.title: Welcome to the New Galatean Saga Website
item.description:
A New Home for The Galatean Saga

I’m excited to announce the launch of the new official website for The Galatean Saga! After years on Blogger, I’ve moved to a more flexible platform that better reflects the immersive, multi-dimensional nature of this universe.

Why the Change?

The old Blogger site served us well, but as The Galatean Saga has grown from a single book concept into a multimedia storytelling experimentâ€”spanning novels, music, video, and interactive experiencesâ€”I needed a space that could evolve with it.

Synopsis

2253. On Surinam Station, the story of Commander Gordon Monihan is more than historyâ€”it is a legend. For apprentices Bindy and Bentley, the tale is a debate about glory and heroism. But the silent, watchful apprentice, Bem, hears something else in their Sergeantâ€™s voice. He sees the cracks in the official narrative and understands what the others do not: the truth is far deadlier than the myth.
